summary:
I am a Paediatrician with broad expertise in general paediatrics, including emergency care, inpatient, high dependency and neonatal intensive care.  I am experienced in managing undifferentiated patients in general paediatric clinics, and have a special interest in paediatric allergy.

I have a strong interest in quality improvement, medical education and clinical research. Some of my publications can be viewed here https://orcid.org/0000-0001-9303-2359

currentPositions.description:
Consultant paediatrician with responsibilities for acute paediatrics, inpatient paediatrics and outpatient care (special interest in paediatric allergy)

Clinical lead for Central Vascular Access (PICC Lines)

Previously Clinical lead for Childrens Assessment Unit and Link clinician to Paediatric Eating Disorders Service
currentPositions.title: Consultant Paediatrician

projects.description: In a bid for greater accuracy, some age-based weight estimation formulae have become more complex.  I developed a simple finger-counting technique that aims to make these formulae easier to use.
projects.title: A usability aid for age-based weight estimation formulae

projects.description: Designed and developed a web and Android smartphone app to aid in paediatric weight estimation and resuscitation drug calculations.  The web version of this tool was adopted as a resuscitation aid in Homerton Hospital Paediatric Resuscitation Bay
projects.title: Paediatric Resuscitation Calculator

projects.description: Proposed and wrote a new starter's guide for junior doctors with no previous experience in Neonatal Intensive Care
projects.title: Neonatal Intensive Care New Starter Guide

projects.description: A timer to record and give simple visualisation of performance to aid debrief in Paediatric ED in-situ simulation
projects.title: Simulation Timer - In-Situ Paediatric Emergency Medicine

projects.description: External Reviewer for Paediatric Care Online with responsibilities to review whether content developed is fit for purpose and will assist all child health professionals as they make decisions at the point of care.  This resource was transitioned to Child Protection Portal in June 2020
projects.title: Paediatric Care Online - RCPCH External Peer Reviewer

projects.description: QI Project to address lack of adequate documentation of ECG assessment and interpretation.  Developed paediatric ECG interpretation guidance and documentation checklist from best practice resources and supervised development of electronic form incorporated into the hospital EPR.  Fully implemented and embedded in paediatric practice
projects.title: Paediatric ECG Checklist and Documentation Template

publications.description: Best Evidence Topic (BET) on the use of subcutaneous fluids for rehydration in children
publications.name: Archimedes: Are subcutaneous fluids a viable alternative to intravenous therapy in rehydrating children with gastroenteritis and moderate dehydration?
Just too many things to remember? A survey of paediatric trainees’ recall of Advanced Paediatric Life Support (APLS) weight estimation formulae

publications.description: Age-based weight estimation methods are used in the resuscitation of children deemed too sick to weigh. Some methods involve multiple formulae, which can be difficult to recall and use. This paper presents a conceptually simple finger-counting method that can be used to rapidly estimate weight based on existing age-based formulae
publications.name: A novel tool to aid usability of age-based weight estimation formulae

publications.description: An electronic review of vaccination information in London libraries to ascertain the extent to which they contain messages that undermine the National Health Service (NHS) childhood vaccination schedule.
publications.name: Poster: Information about vaccination in public libraries: results of a catalogue search of the London Libraries Consortium

publications.description: Summary of evidence-based recommendations for the diagnosis of death by neurological criteria (DNC) in infants aged between 37 weeks corrected gestation and 2 months post term.
publications.name: Key messages from a guideline The diagnosis of death by neurological criteria in infants less than 2 months old: RCPCH guideline 2015

publications.description:
We present a review of the Junior MARSIPAN (Management of Really Sick Patients with
Anorexia Nervosa) guideline, which provides paediatricians with a framework for managing
Anorexia Nervosa in the inpatient setting
publications.name: Junior MARSIPAN (Management of Really Sick Patients with Anorexia Nervosa)
publications.publisher: Archive Diseases in Childhood Education and Practice

publications.name: Definition and monitoring of neonatal hypoglycaemia: a nationwide survey of NHS England Neonatal Units
Graphics in sim training (GIST): a technology aid for performance assessment in paediatric emergency department in-situ simulation
publications.publisher: RCPCH Conference 2017 (Association of Paediatric Emergency Medicine)

publications.description:
Acute Kidney Injury (AKI) is a sudden decline in kidney function. AKI in children is associated with an increased risk of death, prolonged hospital stay and the development of chronic kidney disease. Early detection in the paediatric emergency department is important to reduce the risk of harm.

This module provides an approach to assessment and management of Paediatric AKI, based on national guidance from the British Association of Paediatric Nephrology (BAPN).
publications.name: Acute Kidney Injury in Children
Guideline Review: Management of children and young people with an acute decrease in conscious level (RCPCH guideline update 2015)

publications.description: The association between hyperlactataemia and poorer outcomes in acutely unwell adults and children is well recognised. Blood lactate testing has become readily available in acute settings and is considered a first-line investigation in international guidelines for the management of sepsis. However, while healthcare professionals do appreciate the value of measuring blood lactate in acute severe illness, its clinical significance and interpretation remain less well understood. In this paper, we present the evidence for the use of lactate as a diagnostic test and prognostic marker in acutely unwell children.
publications.name: How to interpret lactate

message.text:
Make Diagrams from generative AI 

It doesn't seem to be possible to generate useful diagrams directly from the chat interface.  

The following 2 diagrams were made with chatGPT4 and claude-3-opus with the prompt "Make a concept map using subgraphs in mermaid js to explain mechanisms of ige mediated allergy".

This uses a tool called mermaid js to generate structured text that can be pasted into a live editor at https://mermaid.live to create an diagram. 

Sometimes it will work straight away, but often times you will need to paste in the error messages back into chat a few times to get it to work

this mermaid code can be put back into the free diagram editor drawio:


Mabey could upload a word doc or powerpoint presentation to make it more diagrammy...

ingestedContentSummary.description: Simplify documentation and avoid heavy tools. Open source Visio Alternative. Commonly used for explaining your code! Mermaid is a simple markdown-like script language for generating charts from text via javascript.
ingestedContentSummary.title: Online FlowChart & Diagrams Editor - Mermaid Live Editor

message.text: I like the idea of making diagrams from text - here is my attempt at a template for driver diagrams https://lnkd.in/esyTu-Ur

Omar Yunus my brother in law has been working on a project that uses technology to create the best sadaqat jahriya model (continuous charity) available. So far, his project has been able to make one donation generate 33x more impact than a traditional donation over the course of an average lifetime. You can check it out at Afterfund.co.

I thought I knew everything about being an armed forces spouse - the mobility - 8 schools for our girls - the deployment - 6 tours of Afghanistan - abandoning my career to take piece meal jobs.  Months and years apart for the duration of the Afghan conflict.  Until 3 years ago on this day 8 March 2021, my husband of 17 years, Colonel Nick Carrell, died from a rapid and aggressive form of brain cancer, whilst still serving.

It was then I realised that I didn’t know everything about being an army spouse. I didn’t know that we had 93 days to vacate our home, that my children would soon become ineligible for their eductional bursaries, that my VO would be permitted to support my devastated little family for just six weeks, as they had other more important things for her to do elsewhere ..

I learned that after two weeks, no one from the MoD calls, that they think when they’re handed you a purple pack and an indecent pension that they have “extracted from the bereaved family as clinically as possible “ , their words not  mine.  I learned that no one talks about transition for the spouse or breakfast clubs or drop ins. And for our bereaved children they lose their home, their school, their identity and their parent. 

We had to leave the community we’d lived in for almost 2 decades - were we still armed forces ? No, we’re not serving. Were we veterans ? No we never served.

So who are we ? We’re adrift and so are so many other military bereaved families.

I am working to change the narrative around our military bereaved, to bring together the families, the MoD, the armed forces charity sector, the NHS and other support pathways because we must do better for families who have lost their loved ones whilst serving this country .

This was our last homecoming. Nick had been in Kabul for 8 months with no R&R.

Please help me to spread the word to help raise awareness in galvanising better support to the military bereaved community and in bringing about systemic change in the space that the armed forces community gives to families like mine.  Thanks for reading. 

#mIlitarywives #militaryspouses #armywife #armywidow #militarywidow #warwidow #bereavedfamilies #childhoodbereavement #forceschilden #bereavedmilitarychildren

commentary.text:
Omar Yunus thanks Omar!  This is a specific kind of diagram called a driver diagram which is popular in health quality improvement planning.  

There is a way of generating such diagrams from text using generative ai but it can be a bit flaky and a 2 step process I might post on it
